item.title: Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Hinges on Small Towns Hooked on Private Prisons
item.description: Like a growing number of US communities, Torrance County, New Mexico, is convinced its financial survival depends on locking people up.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Adams-Heard, Polly Mosendz, Fola Akinnibi

item.title: Low-Income US Families Face Growing Gap Between Earnings, Costs
item.description: There’s a growing gap between what low-income families earn and what it actually costs to live in the US, according to a new study that says headline measures of inflation fail to capture the burden on these households.
item.dc:creator: Jarrell Dillard, Nazmul Ahasan

item.title: The Dangers of Trump’s Quick-Fix Deals
item.description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
item.dc:creator: Flavia Krause-Jackson

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskiy talk before the funeral of Pope Francis in Vatican City, in a photo provided by the Ukrainian Presidential Press Office, on April 26. Photographer: Ukrainian Presidential Press Office/AP Photo

item.title: US, China to Slash Tariffs in Step Back from Decoupling Brink
item.description: The US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products in a dramatic ratcheting down of trade tensions that buys the world’s two largest economies three months to work toward a broader agreement.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Leonard

media:content.media:description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, right, and US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer in Geneva on May 12. Photographer: Jean-Christophe Bott/AP Photo

item.title: Trump Vows US Drug Price Cuts of Up to 80% in Industry Blow
item.description: President Donald Trump said he plans to order a cut in US prescription drug costs by mandating that Americans pay no more than people in countries that have the lowest price. Shares of pharmaceutical companies fell worldwide.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Derek Wallbank, Hadriana Lowenkron

media:content.media:description: President Donald Trump speaks to members of the media outside the West Wing of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, May 8, 2025. Trump hailed the election of Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost as the pope, the first US national ever to be head of the Catholic Church, and said he looked forward to meeting him.

item.title: Thiam Steps Down as Leader of Ivory Coast Opposition Party
item.description: Tidjane Thiam stepped down as head of Ivory Coast’s main opposition party after his leadership was challenged in court.
item.dc:creator: Kamailoudini Tagba

media:content.media:description: Tidjane Thiam

item.title: Spain’s Defense Champion Indra Bets on Becoming a Tank Maker
item.description: The chairman of Spain’s largest defense firm has a plan for the country to become a key player in Europe’s arms industry: build tanks.
item.dc:creator: Clara Hernanz Lizarraga

media:content.media:description: Angel Escribano

item.title: Kurdish Separatist Group PKK Ends 40-Year War Against Turkey
item.description: A separatist Kurdish group agreed to lay down arms to end a 40-year war for autonomy against Turkey, an historic step that could strengthen Ankara’s aspirations to become a regional powerhouse.
item.dc:creator: Selcan Hacaoglu

media:content.media:description: Protesters hold flags bearing the image of PKK leader Abdullah Ocalan in Qamishli, northeastern Syria, in February. Photographer: Delil Souleiman/Getty Images

item.title: Starmer Vows Big Drop in UK Immigration to Counter Farage’s Rise
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he would end the UK’s “experiment in open borders” with tougher plans to curb migration, seeking to head off the growing electoral threat from Nigel Farage’s populist Reform party.
item.dc:creator: Joe Mayes, Alex Morales

media:content.media:description: Keir Starmer

item.title: Poland to Close Another Russian Consulate Over Sabotage Claims
item.description: Poland ordered the closure of the Russian consulate in Krakow after saying it has proof that a large fire in the country’s capital last year was ordered by Moscow’s secret services, according to the Polish foreign minister.
item.dc:creator: Maciej Martewicz

media:content.media:description: Smoke over the Marywilska 44 shopping center in Warsaw on May 12, 2024.

item.title: Pharmaceutical Stocks Tumble on Trump Plan to Cut US Drug Prices
item.description: Shares of pharmaceutical companies fell across the world after US President Donald Trump said he planned to order a cut in US prescription drug costs to bring them in line with other countries, prompting concern that profits will take a hit.
item.dc:creator: Alice French, Kanoko Matsuyama, Lisa Pham

media:content.media:description: Photo credit should read Feature China/Future Publishing via Getty Images) Photographer: Feature China/Future Publishing

item.title: Global Stocks Climb After US, China Agree to Cut Tariffs for 90 Days
Albania’s Premier on Track to Win Unprecedented Fourth Term
item.description: Albania’s premier is on track to win an unprecedented fourth term as he seeks to finally take the Adriatic country into the European Union and cement its status as a tourist destination.
item.dc:creator: Gresa Kraja

media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Edi Rama casts his vote during parliamentary elections in Tirana, Albania, on May 11. Photographer: Vlasov Sulaj/AP Photo

item.title: What Outlawed PKK Laying Down Arms Means for Turkey and the Kurds
item.description: Tens of thousands of people have been killed in the four decades since Kurdish separatist group the PKK took up arms against the Turkish government.
item.dc:creator: Beril Akman, Selcan Hacaoglu

media:content.media:description: Ethnic Kurds hold a poster of Abdullah Ocalan during Newroz celebrations in Diyarbakir, Turkey, on March 21.

item.title: India Envoy Rejects US Calls for Mediation in Kashmir Issue
item.description: A top Indian envoy said the dispute over Kashmir is a bilateral issue with Pakistan, rejecting any external mediation on the matter despite the US saying it wanted to facilitate talks.
item.dc:creator: Ruchi Bhatia

media:content.media:description: Indian paramilitary soldier stand guard on the bank of Dal Lake in Srinagar on May 11. Photographer: Yawar Nazir/Getty Images AsiaPac

item.title: Philippines Midterm Vote Begins As Marcos-Duterte Feud, China Row Flare
item.description: Millions of Philippine voters braved temperatures of up to 44C (111F) to vote in midterm elections that could decide the fate of impeached Vice President Sara Duterte as she feuds with President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.
item.dc:creator: Cliff Harvey Venzon, Neil Jerome Morales

item.title: Hamas Says It Will Free Last Living American Hostage in Gaza
item.description: Hamas said it will release the last living American hostage held in Gaza after renewed talks with the US over a truce deal with Israel.
item.dc:creator: Sherif Tarek, Dan Williams

media:content.media:description: Varda Ben Baruch holds a photo of her grandson Israeli- American hostage Edan Alexander during a rally of families of hostages held in the Gaza Strip, in Nir Oz, Israel on April 20, 2025.

item.title: Trump’s Ukraine Push Comes to a Head With Challenge to Putin
item.description: Donald Trump’s effort to secure peace in Ukraine is reaching a decisive moment with Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskiy challenging Vladimir Putin to engage in talks this week.
item.dc:creator: Piotr Skolimowski, Daryna Krasnolutska

media:content.media:description: Ukrainian servicemen fire an M109 howitzer toward Russian positions, in an undisclosed area, in the eastern Donetsk region, on April 23, 2025.

item.title: US and China Tout Progress in Trade Talks, Offer Few Details
item.description: The US and China both reported “substantial progress” after two days of talks in Switzerland aimed at de-escalating a trade war, marking what Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng called “an important first step” toward resolving differences.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Leonard, Hugo Miller

media:content.media:description: Scott Bessent, left, and Jamieson Greer after talks between US and Chinese officials in Geneva on May 11.

item.title: Australia’s PM Keeps Chalmers, Wong in Roles in Second Term
item.description: Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese retained Treasurer Jim Chalmers and Foreign Minister Penny Wong in their portfolios as he unveiled changes to his lineup just over a week after decisively winning an election.
item.dc:creator: Ben Westcott

media:content.media:description: Anthony Albanese Photographer: Brent Lewin/Bloomberg

item.title: Words Are Enough to Give Markets a Roadmap for US-China Success
item.description: Monday’s moderate market reaction to progress in US-China trade talks at least gave investors a roadmap for how a significant breakthrough might play out.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Tajitsu, Anya Andrianova, Matthew Burgess

media:content.media:description: A trader works on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Wednesday, May 7, 2025. Federal Reserve officials held interest rates steady for a third-straight meeting and emphasized they see a growing risk of both higher inflation and rising unemployment.

item.title: US House to Claw Back Biden’s Climate Law to Fund Trump Tax Cuts
item.description: US House Republicans plan to help pay for an extension of President Donald Trump’s massive tax cuts by clawing back unused funds from scores of programs and grants in his predecessor’s signature climate law.
item.dc:creator: Ari Natter

item.title: Japan Rules Out Trade Deal With US That Excludes Auto Tariffs
item.description: Japan won’t accept any initial trade agreement with the US that excludes an accord on autos, according to Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba.
item.dc:creator: Yoshiaki Nohara

media:content.media:description: Shigeru Ishiba Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: Americans Embrace Road Trips as Economic Fears Discourage Flying
item.description: Kristin Herman and her partner had been planning a European getaway with stops in Paris and Rome, but with the US economy suddenly wobbling, the couple instead drove to Oregon’s nearby redwood forests and Cannon Beach — even camping some nights to save on hotels.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Nathan Risser

media:content.media:description: Traffic moves along Interstate 80 in Emeryville, California, US, on Wednesday, Nov. 27, 2024. AAA projects 79.9 million travelers will head 50 miles or more from home over the Thanksgiving holiday travel period. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: After Driving Down Oil, Saudi Arabia’s MBS Looks for Trump Dividend
item.description: Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia's MBS both want to monetize their relationship. It just might not be in the way Trump had envisaged.
item.dc:creator: Sam Dagher

media:content.media:description: Mandatory Credit: Photo by Ukrainian Presidency/SIPA/Shutterstock (14368321b) Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with Crown Prince and Prime Minister of Saudi Arabia Mohammed bin Salman Al Saud in Saudi Arabia During a working visit. Ryad, SAUDI ARABIA-27 February 2024 (Ukrainian Presidential Press Office via SIPA) SIPA PRESS PROVIDES ACCESS TO THIS PUBLICLY DISTRIBUTED HANDOUT PHOTO PROVIDED BY UKRAINIAN PRESIDENTIAL PRESS OFFICE Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy Working visit to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Ryad - 27 Feb 2024

item.title: Medicaid Work Requirements Sought in Bill to Fund Trump Tax Cuts
item.description: House Republicans want to impose work requirements on some Medicaid recipients up to 64 years old and impose more costs on some beneficiaries to help pay for President Donald Trump’s planned sweeping tax package.
item.dc:creator: Billy House, Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Erik Wasson

item.title: S. Korean Conservatives Choose Right-Winger as Campaign Begins
item.description: South Korea’s ruling conservatives opted for a right-wing candidate in the mold of ousted leader Yoon Suk Yeol to take on frontrunner Lee Jae-myung as the official campaign for the June 3 presidential election kicked off.
item.dc:creator: Soo-Hyang Choi

media:content.media:description: Kim Moon-soo in Seoul on May 12.

item.title: Trump Set to Accept Luxury Jet as Gift From Qatar, ABC Says
item.description: President Donald Trump’s administration is likely to accept a luxury Boeing 747-8 jumbo jet from Qatar’s royal family, in what may be the most valuable gift ever received from a foreign government, ABC News reported Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Gabriela Mello, Annmarie Hordern, Billy House

media:content.media:description: A 13-year-old private Boeing aircraft that President Donald Trump toured takes off from Palm Beach International Airport in West Palm Beach.

item.title: Trump Truce Leaves India Furious, Pakistan Elated as Risks Loom
item.description: After four days that saw the worst fighting between India and Pakistan in half a century, as well as some nuclear saber-rattling, Donald Trump on Saturday declared that both countries had reached a “FULL AND IMMEDIATE CEASEFIRE.”
item.dc:creator: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Faseeh Mangi, Dan Strumpf, Akayla Gardner

media:content.media:description: A resident inspects a damaged house after cross-border shelling along the Line of Control between Pakistan and India in the Neelum Valley of Pakistan-administered Kashmir, on May 11.

item.title: Japan’s Sputtering Economy Likely Stalled Before Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Japan’s economy likely suffered a contraction in the first three months of this year, signaling underlying fragility even before US tariff measures started hitting the country in earnest, according to economists surveyed by Bloomberg.
item.dc:creator: Toru Fujioka
